msg.data:
Must be used before SparkInterpreter (%spark) initialized
Hint: put this paragraph before any Spark code and restart Zeppelin/Interpreter

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

my_spark = SparkSession \
    .builder \
    .appName("myApp") \
    .config("spark.mongodb.input.uri", "mongodb://172.19.0.1:8888/articles.posts") \
    .config("spark.mongodb.output.uri", "mongodb://172.19.0.1:8888/articles.posts") \
    .getOrCreate()

df = spark.read.format("com.mongodb.spark.sql.DefaultSource").load()

%pyspark

from pyspark.ml.feature import Tokenizer, StopWordsRemover
from pyspark.ml.feature import CountVectorizer, RegexTokenizer
from nltk.stem import WordNetLemmatizer
from nltk.stem.porter import *
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from pyspark.sql.functions import udf
import pyspark.sql.functions as f

tokenizer = Tokenizer(inputCol="article", outputCol="words")
wordsData = tokenizer.transform(df)
remover = StopWordsRemover(inputCol="words", outputCol="filtered")
filteredData = remover.transform(wordsData)
filteredData.cache()

def stem(in_vec):
    out_vec = []
    for t in in_vec:
        t_stem = stemmer.lemmatize(t)
        if len(t_stem) > 5:
            out_vec.append(t_stem)       
    return out_vec
        
stemmer_udf = udf(lambda x: stem(x), ArrayType(StringType()))
#lemmatize words
stemmer = WordNetLemmatizer()
articles = filteredData.select('article')
tokenizer = RegexTokenizer(inputCol="article", outputCol="words", pattern=r'[^\w+]')
wordsData = tokenizer.transform(articles)
#remove stopwords
remover = StopWordsRemover(inputCol="words", outputCol="filtered")
filteredData1 = remover.transform(wordsData)
    
# Create user defined function for stemming with return type Array<String>
vector_stemmed_df = (
    filteredData1
        .withColumn("vector_stemmed", stemmer_udf("filtered"))
        .select("vector_stemmed")
    )
    
#obtain top 20 words 
wordCounts = vector_stemmed_df.withColumn('wordCount', f.explode(f.col('vector_stemmed'))).groupBy('wordCount').count().sort('count', ascending=False).select('wordCount','count').limit(20)
wordCounts.show()

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
#group based on state
from pyspark.sql.types import *
import re

distinctStates = filteredData.select('state').distinct()
lists = []
#for all states
for state in distinctStates.collect():
    articles = filteredData.select('article').where(filteredData.state == state["state"])
    #get count of articles per state
    count = articles.count()
    stateId = state["state"]
    tokenizer = RegexTokenizer(inputCol="article", outputCol="words", pattern=r'[^\w+]')
    wordsData = tokenizer.transform(articles)
    #remove stopwords
    remover = StopWordsRemover(inputCol="words", outputCol="filtered")
    filteredData1 = remover.transform(wordsData)
    #lemmatize data
    vector_stemmed_df = (
        filteredData1
            .withColumn("vector_stemmed", stemmer_udf("filtered"))
            .select("vector_stemmed")
      )
    #obtain top 20 words
    vector = vector_stemmed_df.withColumn('wordCount', f.explode(f.col('vector_stemmed'))).groupBy('wordCount').count().sort('count', ascending=False).limit(20)
    vector.show()
    vectorWords = vector.agg(f.concat_ws(", ", f.collect_list('wordCount')).alias('words'))
    lists.append((stateId, vectorWords.first()[0], count))
        
wordsState = spark.createDataFrame(lists, ['State', 'Keywords', 'ArticleCount'])
wordsState=wordsState.where("state!=''")
wordsState.show()

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
#group based on news category
distinctCategories = filteredData.select('category').distinct()
lists = []
#for every category
for category in distinctCategories.collect():
    if len(category) < 2:
        articles = filteredData.select('article').where(filteredData.category == category["category"])
        #get count of articles per category
        count = articles.count()
        categoryId = category["category"]
        tokenizer = RegexTokenizer(inputCol="article", outputCol="words", pattern=r'[^\w+]')
        wordsData = tokenizer.transform(articles)
        #remove stop words
        remover = StopWordsRemover(inputCol="words", outputCol="filtered")
        filteredData1 = remover.transform(wordsData)
        #lemmatize words
        vector_stemmed_df = (
            filteredData1
                .withColumn("vector_stemmed", stemmer_udf("filtered"))
                .select("vector_stemmed")
          )
        #get word count
        vector = vector_stemmed_df.withColumn('wordCount', f.explode(f.col('vector_stemmed'))).groupBy('wordCount').count().sort('count', ascending=False).limit(20)
        vectorWords = vector.agg(f.concat_ws(", ", f.collect_list('wordCount')).alias('words'))
        lists.append((categoryId, vectorWords.first()[0], count))
        
wordsCategory = spark.createDataFrame(lists, ['Category', 'Keywords', 'ArticleCount'])
wordsCategory = wordsCategory.where("Category!='\n'")
wordsCategory.show()
